oai_dc:dc.dc:title: High strain rate in-plane shear behavior of composites
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GOWTHAM, HL
POTHNIS, JR
RAVIKUMAR, G
NAIK, NK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: In-plane shear properties
High strain rate
Split Hopkinson pressure bar
Off-axis testing
Compression
Tension
AXIS TENSION TEST
UNIDIRECTIONAL COMPOSITES
MECHANICAL-PROPERTIES
FABRIC COMPOSITES
IOSIPESCU TEST
STRENGTH
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Studies are presented on in-plane shear properties of a typical plain weave E-glass/epoxy composite under high strain rate loading. In-plane shear properties were determined with +/- 45 degree off-axis compression and tension tests using a split Hopkinson pressure bar apparatus. In-plane shear properties are presented as a function of axial and shear strain rates. The range of axial strain rates for off-axis compression tests was 819-2003 per sec, and for off-axis tension tests was 91-180 per sec, whereas the range of shear strain rates for off-axis compression tests was 1388-3442 per sec and for off-axis tension tests was 153-303 per sec. In general, it was observed that in-plane shear strength was enhanced at high strain rate loading compared to that at quasi-static loading. Also, it was observed that in-plane shear strength increased with increasing strain rate within the range of strain rates considered. (C) 2013 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
